title: Get this MacBook Pro and MS Office power pair for just $419 while you can
description: Modern performance, classic apps, and a very friendly price.
content:
TL;DR: Don’t miss this grade-A refurbished MacBook Pro 13″ (2020) + Microsoft Office Home & Business 2021 lifetime license for just $419.99 (MSRP $1,799) and get sleek performance, pro-level apps, and no monthly fees.

Whether you’re running a freelance business from your apartment, managing your inbox between LIRR stops, or just want a solid machine that won’t quit on you mid-edit, this MacBook Pro + Microsoft Office bundle is built to keep up.

For just $419.99, you’re getting a like-new 2020 Apple MacBook Pro 13″, featuring a 2.0GHz quad-core Intel Core i5, 16GB RAM, and a snappy 512GB SSD. It’s sleek, powerful, and has enough battery life to last through a full day of back-to-back Zoom calls, creative sessions, or streaming your favorite series during lunch. It comes in near-mint condition, too.

The Retina display with True Tone tech keeps everything looking sharp and easy on the eyes, while the Magic Keyboard + Touch Bar combo makes flying through tasks feel intuitive. Add in four Thunderbolt 3 ports and you’re ready for anything—external displays, charging, fast file transfers—you name it.

And the cherry on top? A lifetime license to Microsoft Office Home & Business 2021 for Mac. No subscriptions. No annoying monthly fees. Just Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, and OneNote, installed directly on your Mac and ready to go, whether you’re budgeting groceries or building client decks.

You don’t need to be a Wall Street analyst or a fancy SoHo designer to appreciate high performance at a low price. This bundle delivers serious value with minimal fuss—and saves you over $1,300 off the regular MSRP.

So if your current setup is holding you back, consider this your sign: upgrade like a pro without paying like one.

This grade-A refurbished MacBook Pro 13″ (2020) + Microsoft Office Home & Business 2021 lifetime license is just $419.99 (MSRP $1,799) while stock is still available.
